Project Ideas

Future research directions and project concepts

These are some research directions and project ideas I‚Äôm interested in exploring. Feel free to reach out if you‚Äôre interested in collaborating on any of these topics!

ü§ñ Advanced Actuator Systems

High-Torque Density Actuators for Micro-Robotics

Motivation: Current miniature robots lack sufficient torque for complex manipulation tasks.

Approach: Develop ultra-compact planetary actuators with torque densities >100 Nm/kg for robots under 1kg.

Challenges: Manufacturing precision at small scales, heat dissipation, cost-effective production.

Potential Impact: Enable new applications in medical robotics, inspection, and swarm robotics.

Variable Stiffness Actuators for Adaptive Locomotion

Motivation: Fixed-stiffness actuators limit adaptability to different terrains.

Approach: Design a compact variable stiffness mechanism integrated with planetary gearboxes.

Challenges: Additional complexity, control algorithms, mechanical reliability.

Potential Impact: Improved energy efficiency and terrain adaptability in legged robots.

ü¶ø Novel Leg Mechanisms

Multi-Modal Leg Architecture

Motivation: Current legged robots are optimized for a single locomotion mode.

Approach: Design leg mechanisms that can morph between configurations (walking, running, jumping, climbing).

Challenges: Mechanical complexity, switching control, structural reliability.

Potential Impact: Versatile robots capable of diverse tasks without mode-specific hardware.

Energy-Regenerative Suspension System

Motivation: Energy loss during landing impacts in legged robots.

Approach: Integrate regenerative shock absorbers with energy recovery mechanisms.

Challenges: Efficiency, weight addition, control integration.

Potential Impact: Extended operation time for battery-powered robots.

üîß Design Optimization

AI-Driven Actuator Design Framework

Motivation: Traditional design optimization is time-consuming and limited by human intuition.

Approach: Develop ML-based generative design tools specifically for actuator systems.

Challenges: Training data generation, physical constraint enforcement, manufacturability.

Potential Impact: Accelerate development of novel actuator configurations.

üåç Sustainability in Robotics

Bio-Degradable Robotic Components

Motivation: Environmental impact of disposable robots (e.g., search and rescue, agriculture).

Approach: Research bio-degradable materials suitable for structural and mechanical components.

Challenges: Material strength, durability during operation, controlled degradation.

Potential Impact: Reduce environmental footprint of robotic applications.

üéì Interdisciplinary Projects

Robotic Prosthetics with Natural Motion

Motivation: Current prosthetics lack the fluidity and energy efficiency of biological limbs.

Approach: Apply legged robotics principles to develop biomimetic prosthetic legs.

Challenges: User interface, real-time adaptation, weight constraints, cost.

Potential Impact: Improved quality of life for amputees.

üí≠ Collaboration Opportunities

I‚Äôm always open to collaboration on these or related topics. If you‚Äôre interested in working together, please reach out via email.
